dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "All right, this is how we're gonna..."
dialogueTree.text: All right, this is how we're gonna do it:

links.title: You: ""I admire your handiwork,*chéf*, bu..."
links.text: "I admire your handiwork,*chéf*, but there are a few things I'd do differently."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Like what, officer?" His eyes rest..."
links.text: "Like what, officer?" His eyes rest on the sandwich. "This is as good as they come in Revachol, I assure you."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "An array of delicious recipes flash..."
links.text: An array of delicious recipes flashes through your mind. Salads... Salmon... Sandwiches. Bingo!

links.title: Interfacing: "This calls for an engineering angle..."
links.text: This calls for an engineering angle. Structural rigidity, exposed rafters, lattice-works -- that type of approach.

links.title: Logic: "Lattice-works? Like *Lettuce-works*..."
links.text: Lattice-works? Like *Lettuce-works*? I see what you did there. Don't ever do that again.

links.title: You: ""The bread you built this wonder on..."
links.text: "The bread you built this wonder on, could have been toasted beforehand."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""That *would* certainly have been a..."
links.text: "That *would* certainly have been an improvement."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Beautiful, now bring it home with p..."
links.text: Beautiful, now bring it home with paprika.

links.title: You: ""I'll do you one better -- the air..."
links.text: "I'll do you one better -- the air pocket between cheese and ham could house pre-roasted paprika."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""*Ce serait délicieux*! he shouts e..."
links.text: "*Ce serait délicieux*! he shouts excitedly. "Can you make that sandwich, officer?"

links.title: Logic: "No problem, you just need *his* for..."
links.text: No problem, you just need *his* for research and development first. Just as a prototype of course. Stall now and the sandwich is forever lost.

links.title: You: ""Sure, but I'm going to need yours..."
links.text: "Sure, but I'm going to need yours as a *prototype* first."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""I hope you are not just tricking a..."
links.text: "I hope you are not just tricking an old man out of the little he has left." He says solemnly and hands you his sandwich.

links.title: You: ""Initial development takes time of..."
links.text: "Initial development takes time of course, but in six to nine months you *will* eat 'The Sandwich of Gods'."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Or god of sandwiches maybe?" he tr..."
links.text: "Or god of sandwiches maybe?" he tries to pitch in. "But in the meanwhile, what can I do for you *here* and *now* officer?"

links.title: You: ""I... I win...?""
Gaston Martin: ""Ee... okay, sure sure," he quiets..."
links.text: "Ee... okay, sure sure," he quiets you. "Everybody wins, but is there anything I can help you with right now to *speed up* the process?"

links.title: You: ""Don't worry, about it." (Give him..."
links.text: "Don't worry, about it." (Give him a wink.)

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Ee... okay, sure sure, I'm not wor..."
links.text: "Ee... okay, sure sure, I'm not worried. We're here all the time. Every day. Impossible to miss us, officer."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "He looks worried."
links.text: He looks worried.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Is there anything I can do for you..."
links.text: "Is there anything I can do for you right now?" he asks. "Maybe to speed the whole process up a bit?"

links.title: You: ""No. No one can." (Gaze at the dist..."
links.text: "No. No one can." (Gaze at the distance, slowly shaking your head.)

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Wait... But I thought..." The old-..."
links.text: "Wait... But I thought..." The old-timer, visibly disappointed, pockets the sandwich and sighs. "I'd really like to get back to the game now, if there isn't anything else?"

links.title: You: ""Had you put a large slice of Olduv..."
links.text: "Had you put a large slice of Olduvaian cheese crosswise from the ham, it would minimize the component loss via crumbling."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""*Mon dieu*, that is an excellent i..."
links.text: "*Mon dieu*, that is an excellent idea!" he exclaims. "That would virtually negate the component loss."

links.title: You: ""How is your back, Gaston?" (Tap on..."
links.text: "How is your back, Gaston?" (Tap on the side of your nose and point to the sandwich.)  "Is it... *jerky*?"

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Well yes, I mean... uh... no need..."
links.text: "Well yes, I mean... uh... no need to..." He raises his arms to signal you to stop. "I'm not sure I understand what's happening here, officer."

links.title: Drama: "He knows exactly what's going on."
links.text: He knows exactly what's going on.

links.title: You: ""I got a keen eye and it's telling..."
links.text: "I got a keen eye and it's telling me this sandwich is gonna destroy your back."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." he looks down for the longe..."
links.text: "Oh..." he looks down for the longest time. "You're right of course, officer. It can't be good for my health. Please, take it off my hands."

links.title: Gaston Martin: "The old man nods and turns away fro..."
links.text: The old man nods and turns away from you.

links.title: Conceptualization: "And now we both walk away and every..."
links.text: And now we both walk away and everybody lives.

links.title: You: ""Just give me the damn sandwich, so..."
links.text: "Just give me the damn sandwich, so I don't have to explain."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""I understand the situation," he sa..."
links.text: "I understand the situation," he says quietly and hands you the sandwich. "Please... just take it slowly. Give her the attention she deserves."

links.title: You: "Point to the sandwich in silence."
links.text: Point to the sandwich in silence.

links.title: Gaston Martin: "He nods, understanding the finality..."
links.text: He nods, understanding the finality of the situation, and hands you the sandwich. "Please... just take it slowly. Give her the attention she deserves."

dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "Sorry, but at this point, all that'..."
dialogueTree.text: Sorry, but at this point, all that's left to do is beg and hope for the best. Beg like you've never begged before.

links.title: You: "I'm not gonna beg."
links.text: I'm not gonna beg.

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's probably for the best. People..."
links.text: It's probably for the best. People don't like beggars.

links.title: Rhetoric: "No time to bring him in. Just keep..."
links.text: No time to bring him in. Just keep your eyes on the prize and ignore him.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Eh... I don't think that's gonna h..."
links.text: "Eh... I don't think that's gonna happen." He chuckles. "Why would you even...?"

links.title: You: ""First they take our jobs, then our..."
links.text: "First they take our jobs, then our women and when the sandwich is all you have left -- the anarchists will come for that too."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""He won't care." The old veteran gl..."
links.text: "He won't care." The old veteran glances at his partner. "As long as there's food in his fat belly, he'll lick any boot that's kicking it to him..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Good, René's on board too -- time t..."
links.text: Good, René's on board too -- time to take back the streets. Right-wing populism, here we come!

links.title: You: ""Don't you guys get it? Us, local b..."
links.text: "Don't you guys get it? Us, local boys, gotta stick together. Make the people feel safe again."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""*Now* you are talking sense, son."..."
links.text: "*Now* you are talking sense, son." His eyes light up. "All three of us, working as a group -- we can make a difference."

links.title: Suggestion: "Whatever you're selling there -- he..."
links.text: Whatever you're selling there -- he's buying it. In bulk.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm actually already a member in a..."
links.text: "I'm actually already a member in a group tasked to keep the streets safe," the lieutenant marks. "You are too. We call ourselves *The Police*."

links.title: You: ""Kim, I got this." (Wink at him.)"
links.text: "Kim, I got this." (Wink at him.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you sure?" The lieutenant rais..."
links.text: "Are you sure?" The lieutenant raises his eyebrows. "Cause right now it looks like you're organizing a vigilante group."

links.title: You: ""Men, let's review and, possibly, *..."
links.text: "Men, let's review and, possibly, *redistribute* our resources." (Continue.)

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""What do you mean, officer?" There'..."
links.text: "What do you mean, officer?" There's a look of suspicion is his eyes.

links.title: Authority: "Ignore him. You are addressing the..."
links.text: Ignore him. You are addressing the entire group now.

links.title: You: ""We'll be unit one, *Ghost Dogs*. Y..."
links.text: "We'll be unit one, *Ghost Dogs*. You and Gaston are unit two -- *The Royal Hounds*."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Agreed. What about the whole group..."
links.text: "Agreed. What about the whole group?" He quickly adds: "I propose *Épées de la Couronne* -- Swords of the Crown, in honour of my old unit."

links.title: Conceptualization: "I'm sure we can come up with someth..."
links.text: I'm sure we can come up with something with a bit more *oomph* than that.

links.title: Half Light: "Oh my god, stop this scheming and j..."
links.text: Oh my god, stop this scheming and just demand the sandwich!

links.title: You: ""No, that's too old school. How abo..."
links.text: "No, that's too old school. How about...?"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""How about what?!" Judging by his t..."
links.text: "How about what?!" Judging by his tone the old carabineer really wanted to honour his old unit.

links.title: You: ""The Filippian Four?""
links.text: "The Filippian Four?"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""It's dignified. I like it. We need..."
links.text: "It's dignified. I like it. We need dignity. And you..." He points to Gaston. "Get excited."

links.title: You: ""Guillaume's Lions?""
links.text: "Guillaume's Lions?"

links.title: You: ""Guillaume's Millions?""
links.text: "Guillaume's Millions?"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""It's weird. I don't like it. We'll..."
links.text: "It's weird. I don't like it. We'll go with mine for now and you..." He points to Gaston. "Get excited."

links.title: You: ""Frissel Firing Squad?""
links.text: "Frissel Firing Squad?"

links.title: You: ""Suzerain Solution?""
links.text: "Suzerain Solution?"

links.title: You: ""The Three Boiadeiros?""
links.text: "The Three Boiadeiros?"

links.title: You: ""The Lawbringers?""
links.text: "The Lawbringers?"

links.title: You: ""The Migrant Bashers?""
links.text: "The Migrant Bashers?"

links.title: You: ""The Vigil Flame?""
links.text: "The Vigil Flame?"

links.title: You: ""Revachol Curbstompers?""
links.text: "Revachol Curbstompers?"

links.title: You: ""Actually, let's honour your old un..."
links.text: "Actually, let's honour your old unit -- *Épées de la Couronne* it is!"

links.title: You: ""It's got class. And roots. I like..."
links.text: "It's got class. And roots. I like it."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""It's dignified. We need dignity. A..."
links.text: "It's dignified. We need dignity. And you..." He points to Gaston. "Get excited."

links.title: Authority: "His tone leaves no room for argumen..."
links.text: His tone leaves no room for arguments. Giving orders is a second skin to the old carabineer.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Alright, alright," the old man is..."
links.text: "Alright, alright," the old man is taken aback by René's commanding tone, but dares not dispute him. "I have a bad feeling about this."

links.title: You: ""Good good, now that this is done -..."
links.text: "Good good, now that this is done -- GIVE ME THE SANDWICH!"

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." His eyes light up in unders..."
links.text: "Oh..." His eyes light up in understanding. "You went through all that trouble for my sandwich? I'm flattered, officer, but my answer is no. Now how else can I help you?"

links.title: You: ""Just one small thing -- your sandw..."
links.text: "Just one small thing -- your sandwich. I wanna hold it for a moment."

links.title: You: ""It's okay, Gaston, just *please* g..."
links.text: "It's okay, Gaston, just *please* give me the sandwich now."

links.title: You: ""Stop it! I *just* want the sandwic..."
links.text: "Stop it! I *just* want the sandwich. Give it to me!"

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." His eyes light up in unders..."
links.text: "Oh..." His eyes light up in understanding. "All that for a sandwich? I'm flattered, officer, but you can't have it. It's mine."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Goddamnit..." the old carabineer l..."
links.text: "Goddamnit..." the old carabineer looks at you, disgusted. "I thought I had you measured, but you can't really measure a slug, can you?"

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Not speaking from experience, but y..."
links.text: Not speaking from experience, but yes, you can. It's a common practice among the slug-enthusiasts.

links.title: Suggestion: "Manipulating his patriotic impulses..."
links.text: Manipulating his patriotic impulses like that? René is gonna remember that.

links.title: You: ""I'll be unit one, *Ghost Dog*. You..."
links.text: "I'll be unit one, *Ghost Dog*. You and Gaston are unit two -- *The Royal Hounds*."

links.title: You: ""On second thought... I don't wanna..."
links.text: "On second thought... I don't wanna organize a vigilante group after all." (Drop it.)

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Goddamnit, son..." He pushes back..."
links.text: "Goddamnit, son..." He pushes back his cap. "Once you realize Martinaise -- all of Revachol -- is *actually* going to shit, it will be too late."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""So..." The sandwich-owner looks at..."
links.text: "So..." The sandwich-owner looks at you, obviously confused. "Is there something I can help you with instead or...?"

links.title: You: ""Revachol is calling -- she needs u..."
links.text: "Revachol is calling -- she needs us. Not tomorrow, not *soon*, but right now. Let's take our home back."

links.title: You: ""Cause that's how foreigners *are*,..."
links.text: "Cause that's how foreigners *are*, Gaston. They won't stop 'till you have nothing left."

links.title: You: ""Please, please, just *PLEASE* let..."
links.text: "Please, please, just *PLEASE* let me have the sandwich, Gaston!"

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""No, officer." The culinary genius..."
links.text: "No, officer." The culinary genius shakes his head with unexpected resolve. "Please let it go, It's making me really uncomfortable."

dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "A man so principled about his sandw..."
dialogueTree.text: A man so principled about his sandwich calls for a principled approach. Time to get political.

links.title: You: "What is *political*?"
links.text: What is *political*?

links.title: Rhetoric: "*This* right here is political..."
links.text: *This* right here is political...

links.title: You: ""This city's going to shit. Sooner..."
links.text: "This city's going to shit. Sooner or later some foreign anarchist is gonna *steal* your sandwich. That's a fact."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What the hell are you talking abou..."
links.text: "What the hell are you talking about? What *foreign anarchist*?" the lieutenant asks, confused.

links.title: You: ""Your blood-sandwich" (point to it)..."
links.text: "Your blood-sandwich" (point to it) "is a tool of the oppressors, designed to keep the proletariat docile."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What?" The lieutenant gives you a..."
links.text: "What?" The lieutenant gives you a sharp glance. "What *oppressors*?"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""I'm not going to listen to this co..."
links.text: "I'm not going to listen to this commie-*connerie*," he utters through clenched teeth and turns his back to you.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Huh?" The jolly man is scratching..."
links.text: "Huh?" The jolly man is scratching his head in bewilderment. He doesn't understand the situation.

links.title: You: ""Let me ask you, comrade, did *you*..."
links.text: "Let me ask you, comrade, did *you* make the sandwich yourself?"

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Yes, officer." He proudly displays..."
links.text: "Yes, officer." He proudly displays his culinary miracle. It is magnificent.

links.title: You: ""Oh...? Still, the *over-abundance*..."
links.text: "Oh...? Still, the *over-abundance* this sandwich embodies is inherently evil."

links.title: You: ""Look, comrade, the *over-abundance..."
links.text: "Look, comrade, the *over-abundance* this sandwich embodies is inherently evil."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""I really don't understand how my s..."
links.text: "I really don't understand how my sandwich could..." he starts, but falls silent.

links.title: You: ""Wouldn't you rather have a proper..."
links.text: "Wouldn't you rather have a proper sandwich? A sandwich with a soul?"

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""I would rather just have this one,..."
links.text: "I would rather just have this one, officer." He's avoiding your eyes. "It's really good."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Tell this lost comrade what the Peo..."
links.text: Tell this lost comrade what the People's Sandwich would be like. Distil the essence of the Working Man... in a sandwich.

links.title: You: ""But imagine a sandwich absolutely..."
links.text: "But imagine a sandwich absolutely minimal in design. Sleek, efficient, simple."

links.title: Gaston Martin: "The scepticism emanating from the m..."
links.text: The scepticism emanating from the merry senior could be sensed all the way to the Semenine Isles.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "He's not imagining it."
links.text: He's not imagining it.

links.title: You: ""Envision bread as black as the soi..."
links.text: "Envision bread as black as the soil it came from..."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""I don't want to," he argues, glanc..."
links.text: "I don't want to," he argues, glancing at you worriedly. "Look, officer, I like different, *classic* food. Fine dining, not soil. Please, just drop it."

links.title: You: ""Melting butter, yellow like the su..."
links.text: "Melting butter, yellow like the sun shining on the backs of workers on the fields..."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""I don't eat worker-food!" he blurt..."
links.text: "I don't eat worker-food!" he blurts out, immediately regretting it. "Look, officer, I like different, *classic* food. Fine dining, not *worker backs*. Please, just drop it."

links.title: You: ""Salt is essential -- there can't b..."
links.text: "Salt is essential -- there can't be too much -- because isn't proletariat the salt of society?"

links.title: Gaston Martin: "The sandwich owner looks at you, ey..."
links.text: The sandwich owner looks at you, eyes filled with anguish. "You're describing prison food, officer. I like different, *better* food. Fine dining, not *jailtime*. Please, just drop it."

links.title: You: ""Now turn it upside down, black bre..."
links.text: "Now turn it upside down, black bread -- like a symbol -- on top, to salute the coal mines our heroes worked."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""No, everything would fall off," he..."
links.text: "No, everything would fall off," he argues, glancing at you worriedly. "Look, officer, I'm not a miner. I like different, *tasty* food. Fine dining, not coal. Please, just drop it."

links.title: You: ""But imagine a sandwich covered ent..."
links.text: "But imagine a sandwich covered entirely in fine metal dust from an industrial plant..."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""That sounds *horrible*." A grimace..."
links.text: "That sounds *horrible*." A grimace of disgust runs over his jolly face. "You really don't know your way around the kitchen, officer. Food and politics don't mix."

links.title: You: ""I don't either, but wouldn't you r..."
links.text: "I don't either, but wouldn't you rather eat a sandwich free of the *bourgeois* guilt-baggage?"

links.title: You: ""Nothing. Actually, let's talk abou..."
links.text: "Nothing. Actually, let's talk about something else."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""I'm listening, officer." He nods."
links.text: "I'm listening, officer." He nods.

links.title: You: "These options seem awfully fascist..."
links.text: These options seem awfully fascist or communist -- what if I don't wanna say them?

links.title: Rhetoric: "No. You're gonna starve to death."
links.text: No. You're gonna starve to death.

links.title: Endurance: "You're not. Everything is fine."
links.text: You're not. Everything is fine.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Say one of these fascist or communi..."
links.text: Say one of these fascist or communist things or fuck off.

links.title: Volition: "Whoa... easy there, Gold Mouth. He..."
links.text: Whoa... easy there, Gold Mouth. He doesn't *have* to say anything. Re-engage cop-mode and bail out, if you like.

links.title: You: ""Back to police-mode." (Smile and n..."
links.text: "Back to police-mode." (Smile and nod.) "I have some questions, Gaston."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Alright." The jolly man smiles. "L..."
links.text: "Alright." The jolly man smiles. "Let's hear them, officer."

links.title: You: "I'm already tripping knee-deep in p..."
links.text: I'm already tripping knee-deep in politics, baby.

links.title: Rhetoric: "You really do. Now, *unleash the fu..."
links.text: You really do. Now, *unleash the fury*!

links.title: You: "I'm not so sure about this..."
links.text: I'm not so sure about this...

links.title: Rhetoric: "Too late. Daddy's already fighting..."
links.text: Too late. Daddy's already fighting the bad fight. Make it stick.
